message: Do you see fingerprints more on black than white?

Black. My TV, laptop, monitor, and phone hav black bevels, why wouldn't my iPad. IMO
@tbeseda I'm with you, black, but why are the bevels always reflective glossy and not a flat black? I am a matte screen guy. White is reserved for the fashionista.

that's the one i got it
I went with white, though I was unsure whether or not I would like it. It really isn't that bad after all.

ill give white this: it's a classy one.
@daddyflor agree. after finally retiring 4 and a half year old (matte) black macbook, im finding glossy black bevel of new mbp's continuously disappointing.
@coryobrien by that logic, OP should buy a samsung galaxy tab.
Go with white. Everyone is going to have a black one. Why not be different?
I think I'd get the white
@calebcherry nope
@tbeseda I agree. IMO the white bezel would be too visually distracting.
I went with white.
I plan to buy black, but if it's sold out, I'd take white. I don't think it will be as distracting as people think. I've used a white MacBook for years and it's never been an issue.
For some reason I just like my gadgets black. Seems more "gadgety" to me :)
I like both
the white is class, but ive always loved the way photos pop against a black frame.

Just watched a ep of iPad today a viewer sent in a video holding a iPad 1 that said some apps running will be very hard to see white background on an app white frame on your iPad she's right pretty hard to read
Sorry she had taped a white frame and is amaized how hard it was to see White background on a White iPad the colars blend in so to speak
Black was sold out. I didn't think that it would ever happen but I'm loving my white iPad.  Absolutely no regrets. I like it even more than my old black iPad.
they were out of white, decision was easier. was likely going with the black anyhow
A lot of people go white iPad so everyone can see they have the iPad 2.
Cool. Glad your enjoying it. I think I'm going to stick to my first gen iPad for now. It does everything I need.
my review of it is on this week in ipad.
basically: if you could get a great price for the old one and have the ability to upgrade, i'd go for it. it's worth a 100-200 upgrade
is it worth 500+ if you already have one? probably not
@Jacob it depends on when and how much you are able to sell your iPad 1.  Timing is everything (along with location).
